title: 114_s1292
content: HUBZone Revitalization Act of 2015 This bill amends the Small Business Act to redefine HUBZones eligible for certain assistance to include a qualified disaster area . A qualified disaster area shall be treated as a HUBZone for 5 years after it has been declared a major disaster area or for 10 years after a catastrophic incident has occurred within it. The Federal Emergency Management Agency shall provide the Small Business Administration with any data it needs to verify a small business's eligibility for the HUBZone small business loan program. HUBZones shall now also include areas that can be used by small businesses whose principal offices are located in base closure HUBZones, with at least 35 of their employees residing in: a HUBZone, a census tract in which the base closure HUBZone is wholly contained, a census tract that intersects the boundaries of the base closure HUBZone, or census tract contiguous with these census tracts. This bill also amends the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005 to extend HUBZone eligibility assistance for base closure areas from five years to eight years after their closure.
